member.name: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.BeginUpdatingAudioObjects
member.summary: Puts the system into the state where audio object data can be submitted for processing and the state can be modified.
member.param: The number of dynamic audio objects that are available to be rendered for the current processing pass. All allocated static audio objects can be rendered in every pass. For information on audio object types, see .
The size, in audio frames, of the buffer returned by .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
BeginUpdatingAudioObjects was called twice without a matching call to between the two calls.
The associated with the spatial audio stream has been destroyed.
The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
A resource associated with the spatial audio stream is no longer valid.
An internal error has occurred.
The media associated with the spatial audio stream uses an unsupported format.

member.name: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.EndUpdatingAudioObjects
member.summary: Notifies the system that the app has finished supplying audio data for the spatial audio objects activated with .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
EndUpdatingAudioObjects was called before .
The associated with the spatial audio stream has been destroyed.
The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
A resource associated with the spatial audio stream is no longer valid.
An internal error has occurred.
The media associated with the spatial audio stream uses an unsupported format.

member.name: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamBase.GetService
member.summary: Gets additional services from the ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStream.

param.name: riid
param.para: The interface ID for the requested service. The client should set this parameter to one of the following REFIID values:

member.param: Pointer to a pointer variable into which the method writes the address of an instance of the requested interface. Through this method, the caller obtains a counted reference to the interface. The caller is responsible for releasing the interface, when it is no longer needed, by calling the interface's method. If the GetService call fails, *ppv is NULL.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
Parameter ppv is NULL.
The associated with the spatial audio stream has been destroyed.
The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
An internal error has occurred.
The media associated with the spatial audio stream uses an unsupported format.

summary.para: Base interface that provides methods for controlling a spatial audio object render stream, including starting, stopping, and resetting the stream. Also provides methods for activating new instances and notifying the system when you are beginning and ending the process of updating activated spatial audio objects and data.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
